description:
Backstab, If she is alone with no other creatures or civilians, she gets +2 to attack.

Dual Wield, on a 5+ on a die, Assassin gets +2 to attack.

Opportunity, for every creature and/or hostile civilian attacking you, the bandit gains +1 to attack and armor.

Crushing Blow, the bandit deals one damage to your health when he attacks.

On the Run, if any guards appear, the fugitive runs away (discard her).

Fines, if you pay the fugitive 2 gold, she will leave you alone.

Rage, for every guard that exists, +1 to the Outlaws armor and attack.

Opposition to Authority, if a king, lord, and/or any trainer is drawn, and no guards exist, the outlaw kills them.

Robber, if the thief would normally damage to your health, she takes your most valuable item instead (discard it), your health remains the same.

Poor Thief, if the thief is killed, roll a D6 on a 1 or a 2, the thief has no items.

(3) Duel, if you challenge the duelist, he will fight you.  If you die during the fight, your health is instead reduced to 1, you do not die.  No matter the outcome, you can continue your turn.  If you defeat him, gain +7xp and he remains on the table.
(3) Trainer, reveal two level cards and choose from one of them, you can also use this to replace level cards.

(2) Human Shield, +3 to your armor.

(5) Fearless Armor, usable during combat, the armored knight absorbs all damage, no damage is dealt to you, but the creatures/monsters cannot be killed, and he deals no damage to them.

(3) Trainer, reveal two level cards and choose from one of them, you can also use this to replace level cards.

(2) Merchant, reveal three items, you can purchase any of these three items.

(3) Trainer, reveal three level cards and choose from one of them, you can also use this to replace level cards.

(4) Sparing Training, Gain 3 XP, lose 2 health.

(3) Trainer, reveal three level cards and choose from one of them, you can also use this to replace level cards.

(3) Weapons upgrade, reveal an item card, the fencer gives it to you if it is a weapon, otherwise discard it.

(1) Spell Buyer, discard a spell, +3 gold.

(2) Magic Merchant, reveal three items, you can purchase any of these three items. If the item is a magic item, discount it by -1 gold, if it is 0 cost, then you can take it for free.

(3) High-Class Merchant, reveal four items, you can purchase any of these at a premium +1 to gold cost.

(5) High-Class Patron, reveal 4 quest cards.

(2) Healer, the lord will offer you x point(s) of healing for x gold.

(3) Patron, reveal 2 quest cards.

(4) Mercenary, keep the card with you, he will aid you in your next travel and protect you during this round.

(5) The Hunt, instantly kill one neutral creature, gain the xp and items associated with this creature.

(2) Eavesdropper, the Peasant will offer you a random quest which he overheard.

(1) Lost and found, reveal one item, you can purchase it if you would like.

(2) Merchant, reveal 3 item cards.

(3) Patron, reveal 2 quest cards.

(4) Healer, heal 5.

(5) Influence, gain 5 xp.

(3) Mercenary, keep the card with you, he will aid you in your next travel and protect you during this round.

(4) Thievery, Choose a player on the same land type as you, the ranger steals a random item that that player has and gives it to you.

(2) Play during combat, your ranged weapons get +4 attack bonus.

(3) Check Traps, draw a random creature: whether it is hostile or not, you choose whether to fight it or not. If you fight it, normal combat rules apply.

Gets +1 bonus to attack and armor when in a forest.

(2) Play during combat, will attack any hostiles just like a guard.

(2) Magic Trainer, reveal 2 magic cards, choose any one to replace an existing card or add it to your pool.

(3) Usable at any time, even during combat: spells cost -2 magic less and can be used instantly.

(3) Noble Magic Trainer, reveal 5 magic cards, choose any one to replace an existing card or add it to your pool. If any are dark magic, discard them.

(3) Teleportation, draw any 5 map cards, choose one to go to.

(2) Dark Magic Trainer, Reveal 4 magic cards, keep the first two dark magic cards drawn as the magic offer, if none or only one are drawn, that is all that is offered.

(5) Soul Devour, lose 5 life, gain 10 xp.

(2) Magic Trainer, reveal one magic card, you may replace an existing card or add it to your pool.

(2) Magic Experiment, roll a die, on a 1,2 lose 2 health, on a 3,4 gain 2 health, on a 5,6, gain 2 xp.

(2) Merchant, reveal 2 item cards.

(4) Mercenary, keep the card with you, he will aid you in your next travel and protect you during this round.

(2) Foresight, shuffle a deck of your choice.

(4) Prophecy, look at the first card of every deck (do not show them to other players), you may discard it or put it back on the top of the deck.

(2) Foresight, shuffle a deck of your choice.

(4) Prophecy, look at the first card of every deck (do not show them to other players), you may discard it or put it back on the top of the deck.
